Dear Ms. Thomas-Cloud:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

II. METHODOLOGY
11/02/2021 Special Investigation Intake 2022C0214003
11/02/2021 Special Investigation Initiated – Telephone interview with
Administrator 1.
11/02/2021 Contact - Face to Face interviews with Supervisor 1, Staff 1, Staff
2, and Youth A.
11/02/2021 Contact - Document Received: Video Recording, personnel file,
incident reports, staff debriefing form, use of physical management
form, and description of behavior management techniques.
11/02/2021 Inspection Completed On-site
11/02/2021 Pre-Exit Conference with Supervisor 1.
11/05/2021 Contact - Telephone call made and interview with Staff 3.
11/08/2021 Contact - Telephone call made and interview with Staff 4.
11/08/2021 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
ALLEGATION:
An incident report was filed which details an incident between staff and youth in
which an appropriate Mandt restraint was used during youth violence. However, at
one point a staff grabbed the youth's shirt which is not an approved restraint method.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Administrator 1 by phone on 11/2/2021. She reported being the
individual who made the report after being informed by Supervisor 1. She also
reported having “nothing more to add” to the complaint other than a debriefing with
the staff involved in the incident was completed.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility on 11/2/2021. She reported being aware
of the incident and conducting the debriefing with all the staff involved the night of
the incident. She identified the individuals in the video recording of the incident and
reported Youth A has a high level of supervisor due to his history of self-harm and
aggression towards others. She also reported Youth A was just placed on
psychotropic medication and is scheduled for a full psychiatric evaluation on
November 18, 2021. Youth A does not speak English and none of the staff at the

facility currently speak his native language. The facility is in the process of finding an
individual who does speak his native language. Staff 1 did not use the appropriate
technique when she grabbed Youth A’s shirt to keep him from assaulting Staff 4.
The treatment team is reviewing the behavior management techniques during the
daily shift change meetings and the monthly team meetings.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 11/2/2021. Supervisor 1 sat in on the
interview because she was familiar with some of the language of Youth A and could
interpret. Youth A reported feelings safe at the facility and being “well taken care of”.
He also reported having “no issues at this time”.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 11/2/2021. She reported being a witness to
the incident and not involving herself because she was not fully trained on the
behavior management technique. She gave a similar accounting of the incident as
stated in the complaint but added not witnessing Staff 1 grabbing Youth A’s shirt.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 11/2/2021. She reported the situation as
reported in the complaint. She made numerous efforts to deescalate Youth A while
using “body positioning in an attempt to keep Youth A and others safe”. She
reported Youth A broke free from her restraint of him and punched Staff 4 in the
back of the head. She attempted to stop Youth A after he broke free by grabbing his
shirt because he was “moving too fast and I missed his body”. She admitted
grabbing Youth A’s shirt was not part of her training.
I interviewed Staff 3 by phone on 11/5/2021. He reported being witness to the
incident but not becoming involved because he had not completed his behavior
management training. He also reported finishing this training two days prior to the
interview. He reported everything with the exception of the shirt grabbing was
appropriate by Staff 1. Staff 1 attempted to keep everyone safe including staff and
Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 4 by phone on 11/8/2021. She reported being present and
being “attacked by Youth A” at the time. She denied observing the restraint because
she had her back turned and was trying to get away from Youth A. She reported a
belief that Staff 1 was trying to protect her from the assault from Youth A.
Video footage of 10/28/2021, Glen’s House was reviewed on 11/2/21. The video
recording revealed two different views of the restraint, and both showed the situation
as described in the complaint and the verbal descriptions given by those present.
Youth A breaks away from Staff 1 and rushes towards Staff 4 before striking her in
the head. Staff 1 can be observed attempting to grab Youth A but only getting a hold
of his shirt.
A tour of the facility occurred on 11/2/21. The area of the restraint was observed,
and staff walked through the incident. The area is appropriate in all aspects.

Documents Reviewed:
 Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 1 completed the
required MANDT training on 6/10/21.
 “Use of Physical Management” form dated 10/28/21 which was consistent with Staff 1’s
description of the incident and the video recording of the incident.
 Incident Report dated 10/28/21 which was consistent with all the staff interviewed
reports.
 Addendum to the Incident report (10/28/21) dated 11/2/21 which was also consistent
with the staff’s interview.
 Staff Debriefing Form dated 10/28/21 which is consistent with the written reports and
staff’s interviews.
 MANDT training techniques of restraints. Description outlined matches the restraint by
Staff 1 with the exception of the grabbing Youth A’s shirt.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures regarding restraint. These policies and
procedures shall be available to all residents, their families,
and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: This facility is found in noncompliance as evidenced by the
video recording and information provided by those involved in
the incident that Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s shirt when attempting
to restrain him.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
III. RECOMMENDATION
With an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that no change be
made to the license of this child caring institution.
